# Draft:Hothi Baswaraj

----
Dr.Hothi Baswaraj (born on 19 June 1979), is a nationally renowned indian contemporary sculptor from Telangana. He also does Realistic and Creative sculptures works including large-scale statues.One of his famous works is Social reformer Mahatma Basweshwar statue at Hussain Sagar,Telangana.[https://www.deccanchronicle.com/nation/current-affairs/280417/hyderabad-social-reformer-basaveshwara-statue-to-line-up-at-tank-bund.html] He also made many tribal museums in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. He is the General Secretary of Telangana Sculptors and Artists Association (TSAA).

= Career =
He received a world record for turmeric Ganesha by Vishwaguru WorldHyderabad, India.According to Indian tradition, before worshipping the gods, the first puja is performed for Sri Ganesha. A paste of turmeric is placed on a betel leaf, and that paste is worshipped as Ganesha. Taking this concept, the sculptor made the form of Lord Ganesha as an idol from a turmeric paste. The idol of Ganesha was made to a height of 5.6 feet. For creating an idol of this height for the first time in the world, Dr. Hoti Basvaraj was awarded by the Viswaguru World Records organization, 2023. He received a Doctorate in Sculpture, from Day Spring Christian University India.social reformer Basaveshwara  style 12 feet height in bronze statue at Tank bund , Hyderabad in 2017. Bhakta Ramadas 10 ft branch statue in Nelakondapalli 2019.Tribal museums Chenchu Adivasi Museum Mannanur, Nagarkurnool , 2017, Kumuram Bheem Tribal Museum in 2016. = Other Activity =
Basava Awards
Every year, in the native village Nyalkal of Dr. Hothi Basavaraj Sculptor, the Peer Saheb Dargah Fair is celebrated.
This festival stands as a symbol of communal harmony, bringing together people from Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and Telangana who actively take part in it.
During this large community gathering, there is a special day called the Bull Fair. On this day, farmers from all four states bring their bulls to buy and sell them at the fair.
In this event, Dr. Hothi Basavaraj Sculptor, in memory of his parents Girijamma(mother) and Hothi Adivappa(father), presents the “Basava Awards” every year to ten outstanding cattle-rearing farmers who have shown excellence in raising and maintaining bulls and calves.
The awards are distributed in the presence of the village elders.
These Basava Awards have been presented to farmers for the past 18 years.
The main objective of this awards is to save and protect cows and bulls and to promote livestock development and encourage natural farming by using bulls in agriculture.
He emphasizes that farming with bulls is more natural and sustainable, and urges farmers to reduce harmful chemicals and grow organic, natural crops.
To make the Basava Awards program successful, his Family, brothers, friends, and villagers actively participate every year.
